name: lab-guide
description: Step-by-step lab guide panel with directional edge-glow arrows for hands-on training

labGuide.profileActive.description: Set to true inside the Lab Guide profile — the extension will not activate without it

labGuide.catalogUrl.description: URL of the course catalog page to open on startup

labGuide.autoActions.description: Automatically execute step actions (open files, terminal, chat) when advancing slides

labGuide.showTips.description: Show tip callouts in the guide panel

labGuide.enforceStepCompletion.description: Require sub-step completion before advancing to the next slide

labGuide.showNotes.description: Show speaker notes below each slide by default

labGuide.followVSCodeMotion.description: Respect VS Code's Reduce Motion setting to disable animations (edge glows, arrows, opening animation)

labGuide.followVSCodeAccessibility.description: Respect VS Code's accessibility settings for screen readers and high contrast themes

walkthroughs.title: Getting Started with Lab Guide
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to navigate courses, switch profiles, and use commands.

steps.title: Welcome to Lab Guide
steps.description:
You are running inside the Lab Guide profile. This is an isolated VS Code environment that keeps your personal settings safe while you work through training labs.

Your extensions, themes, and keybindings in other profiles are untouched.

steps.title: Switching Back Anytime
steps.description:
When you are in another VS Code profile, look for the **$(beaker) Lab Guide** button in the bottom status bar. Click it to switch back to this profile instantly.

You can also use the Command Palette: **Lab Guide: Switch to Profile**.

media.altText: Status bar showing the Lab Guide button

steps.title: Command Palette
steps.description:
All Lab Guide commands are available via `Ctrl+Shift+P` (or `Cmd+Shift+P` on macOS). Type **Lab Guide** to see them:

- **Start Lab** — launch a lab interactively
- **Run Profiler** — recreate the profile from scratch
- **Switch to Profile** — open the Lab Guide profile
- **Remove Profile** — clean up when training is done
- **Open Settings** — configure behavior

media.altText: Command Palette showing Lab Guide commands

steps.title: Open the Course Catalog
steps.description:
Ready to start? The catalog resets your workspace, closes open panels, and loads the full list of available courses. Click a course card to begin a guided lab session.

[Open Catalog](command:labGuide.openCatalog)

media.altText: Course catalog with cards for each course
